page.title: 16The Ghostly Soldier
page.content: This incident happened in the First World War.There were no cars,but people at this time used gigs,pulled by horses.A man was passing St.Johns kirk,going towards the crossroads when suddenly the usually friendly horse pulling the gig shied.It was obviously very frightened.The nearest building to the gig was the kirk,so the man riding in the gig looked towards it.Standing there was the faint outline of a soldier.The soldier was wearing a New Zealand or Australian uniform.The man in the gig had to look away from the soldier for a while as he had to turn at the crossroads.When he looked back to where the soldier once was standing,in his place stood a phantom headless cow.The soldier had died in action at the same time as he appeared and as he used to live in Unst,the horse knew him and shied.
